revised_title: Description and Analysis of a Chinese Pheasant
tldr: This article describes a beautiful Chinese pheasant, known as the Argus, which is the largest species of pheasant discovered at the time. The author, George Edwards, provides a detailed description of the bird's appearance, including its unique eye-like spots on the feathers, colors, and physical features. The bird's skin and a drawing were sent from Canton to John Fothergill, and Edwards uses these materials to create a figure and description of the bird.
